text: Switch is the tenth album by Dutch rock band Golden Earring, released in 1975. ==Track listing== All songs written by Hay and Kooymans except where noted. #"Intro: Plus Minus Absurdio" – 3:08 #"Love Is a Rodeo" – 3:37 #"The Switch" – 5:27 #"Kill Me (Ce Soir)" (John Fenton, Hay, Kooymans) – 6:22 #"Tons of Time" – 4:20 #"Daddy's Gonna Save My Soul" – 4:15 #"Troubles and Hassles" – 4:20 #"Lonesome D.J." – 4:36 ==Personnel== * George Kooymans - guitar, vocals * Rinus Gerritsen - bass, keyboards * Barry Hay - flute, vocals * Cesar Zuiderwijk - drums * Robert Jan Stips - keyboard Additional personnel * Bertus Borgers - saxophone * Eelco Gelling - guitar ==Production== *Producer: Golden Earring *Executive producer: Fred Haayen *Engineer: Andy Knight, John Kriek, Jan Schuurman *Mixing: Andy Knight, John Kriek *Arranger: Golden Earring *String arrangements: Robert Jan Stips *Art direction: George Osaki *Concept: Barry Hay *Photography: Paul Gerritsma, Graham Hughes ==Charts== Album - Billboard (North America) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="550px" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|1975 |align="left"|Pop Albums |align="left"|108 |- |} Album — Kent Music Report (Australia) {| class="wikitable" style="width:550px;" |- !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|1975 |align="left"|Album |align="left"|93 |} ==Trivia== Kill Me (Ce Soir) was covered by Iron Maiden as a B side on their 1990 single "Holy Smoke" On the Dutch pressing, MCA-2139, that was marketed in Europe, the Side 2 label has the song lists double printed. A slight offset is very noticeable. It is unknown how many of these 'double prints' were sold before the manufacturer caught the error. ==References== Category:Golden Earring albums Category:1975 albums Category:Polydor Records albums
title: Switch (Golden Earring album)
